text: Door type (hollow metal, wood, fiberglass) and size matches door schedule & approved submittals
Fire-rated doors, frames, glazing and labels match ULC/WH listing
Hardware type (lever, closer, hinge, panic, stop) matches hardware schedule
Hardware manufacturer and model # match approved templates
Frames plumb, square, and anchored to structure with correct fasteners
Grout or backer in masonry/steel stud frames where specified
Frames have provisions for wiring (e.g., electrified locks, card readers)
Door installed with consistent gap (typically 1/8" sides/top; 3/4" bottom clearance)
Pre-finished doors free from defects, warps, or finish damage
Sound-rated, lead-lined, or specialty doors verified as per location
Hinges installed with correct spacing, tight to frame/leaf, no binding
Closers installed on correct side, torqued per manufacturer, and arm swing tested
Lockset/lever installed, keyed correctly, and functioning without friction
Panic hardware and exit devices compliant with fire/life safety path
Kickplates, stops, silencers, thresholds installed where specified
Door swing and clearances meet fire exit and barrier-free code (ADA/NBC)
Vision lite height and hardware height as per code
Lever hardware usable with closed fist, no pinching/grasping required
All doors swing freely and latch under self-closing
Fire-rated assemblies labeled and documented in closeout
Keying schedule submitted and keys tagged per suite

id: • NBC Part 3 / Part 9, NFPA 80, CAN/ULC-S104 – Fire Doors
• Manufacturer Specs: Dorma, Schlage, LCN, Von Duprin, Allegion
